definition: venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.chinese: 他是个初出茅庐的作家。

sentences.english: I am inexperienced, but also invite more attention.
sentences.chinese: 我初出茅庐，还请多多关照。

sentences.english: She is a good driver, but as a mechanic, she is just a babe in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 她是一个好驾驶，但是她只是个初出茅庐的修车技工。

definition: lit. newborn calves do not fear tigers (idiom)/fig. the young are fearless
pinyin: chu1 sheng1 niu2 du2 bu4 pa4 hu3

definition: first sign of budding talent/to display one's ability for the first time
to assume personal responsibility (idiom); to take charge of a section
still possessing the innocence of childhood (idiom)
full of sap (idiom); young and vigorous
(coll.) sb new to a particular subject/rookie/beginner/newbie
lit. to first show one's horns (idiom); fig. a first show of emerging talent/first sign of emerging talent/budding genius
switch to a job one was not trained for
